page.title: 17Heather Football Club
page.content: Heather Football Club was formed on October 6th 1949, and the first meeting took place at Heather school. The club was named after the Parish Church: Heather St. John's Football Club. All organisations have to be financed in some way. Our football club started by each player paying 3d, just over 1p per game. The first fund-raising was a raffle, the prizes being two ducks and a packet of twenty cigarettes, and each ticket cost 3d. Now, the Club has two teams in the Leicester and District League. Most of the players and committee live or have lived in the village, and our aim is to recruit as many local lads as possible. The Club still plays on the same pitch as they did in 1949.
